author: wsjcom
title: Freedom of Speech at Work at Mount Holyoke
text:
Regarding Kassy Dillon’s “The Women’s March Holds a One-Way ‘Discussion’” (op-ed, April 13): The event was the keynote address for the Women of Color Trailblazers Conference. The conference had 180 registered attendees and the college estimates that 200-225 people attended the keynote address, which was open to the public.
The Q&A format used during the keynote is common. A student organizer moderated and interviewed the panelists, note cards were given out to the audience to solicit audience questions and event organizers...
